texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025
texts.text: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An ACT to regulate the publication and spread of false information, hate speech and other information  relating  to  the  disclosure  of  private  facts  and  the  publication  of confidential matters concerning the Republic, and for related matters.
texts.text: An ACT to regulate the publication and spread of false information, hate speech and other information  relating  to  the  disclosure  of  private  facts  and  the  publication  of confidential matters concerning the Republic, and for related matters.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Overview of the Act
texts.text: Overview of the Act

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Object of the Act
texts.text: Object of the Act

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. (1)   The object of this Act is to protect individuals; groups of persons; private and public institutions;  and  the  Government  from  harm, threat  of  harm,  violence,  fear,  disrepute, discredit, embarrassment, harassment, intimidation, ridicule, unrest, panic and disturbance of the public peace caused by misinformation, disinformation, hate speech, the disclosure of private facts and the publication of confidential matters concerning the Republic.
texts.text: (1)   The object of this Act is to protect individuals; groups of persons; private and public institutions;  and  the  Government  from  harm, threat  of  harm,  violence,  fear,  disrepute, discredit, embarrassment, harassment, intimidation, ridicule, unrest, panic and disturbance of the public peace caused by misinformation, disinformation, hate speech, the disclosure of private facts and the publication of confidential matters concerning the Republic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)   In furtherance of its object in subsection (1), the Act shall be applied to:
texts.text: In furtherance of its object in subsection (1), the Act shall be applied to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) prevent the publication and spread of false information, hate speech and other information, disseminated within or outside the territory of the Republic;
texts.text: (a) prevent the publication and spread of false information, hate speech and other information, disseminated within or outside the territory of the Republic;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) control the publication and spread of false information, hate speech and other information through internet intermediaries and digital advertising intermediaries;
texts.text: (b) control the publication and spread of false information, hate speech and other information through internet intermediaries and digital advertising intermediaries;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) suppress the commercialisation and financing of false information publication;
texts.text: (c) suppress the commercialisation and financing of false information publication;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) undertake measures to be taken to detect, control and safeguard against conduct that threaten the free flow and exchange of reliable information; and
texts.text: (d) undertake measures to be taken to detect, control and safeguard against conduct that threaten the free flow and exchange of reliable information; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) impose sanctions and provide remedies in respect of liability for false and other information.
texts.text: (e) impose sanctions and provide remedies in respect of liability for false and other information.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Scope of the Act
texts.text: Scope of the Act

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. (1) The Act covers the following:
texts.text: (1) The Act covers the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Misinformation;
texts.text: (a) Misinformation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Disinformation;
texts.text: (b) Disinformation;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025
texts.text: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) Hate Speech;
texts.text: (c) Hate Speech;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) Public disclosure of private facts; and
texts.text: (d) Public disclosure of private facts; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) Publication of confidential information concerning the Republic.
texts.text: (e) Publication of confidential information concerning the Republic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Nothing in this Act shall preclude a person from enforcing existing common law remedies in respect of misinformation and disinformation even where both actions run concurrently.
texts.text: Nothing in this Act shall preclude a person from enforcing existing common law remedies in respect of misinformation and disinformation even where both actions run concurrently.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Notwithstanding subsection (2), the Court, Division or other adjudicatory body shall take into consideration the relief sought, or the extent of a remedy granted or sanction imposed or satisfaction for breach offered to the aggrieved party in respect of the same facts forming the basis of misinformation and disinformation before another adjudicatory body.
texts.text: Notwithstanding subsection (2), the Court, Division or other adjudicatory body shall take into consideration the relief sought, or the extent of a remedy granted or sanction imposed or satisfaction for breach offered to the aggrieved party in respect of the same facts forming the basis of misinformation and disinformation before another adjudicatory body.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Existing legislation
texts.text: Existing legislation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. (1) The Act shall be read together with the following enactments:
texts.text: (1) The Act shall be read together with the following enactments:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Cybersecurity Division Act, 2020 (Act 1038) (Cybersecurity Division Act),
texts.text: (a) Cybersecurity Division Act, 2020 (Act 1038) (Cybersecurity Division Act),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Criminal Offences Act, 1960 (Act 29) (Criminal Offences Act),
texts.text: (b) Criminal Offences Act, 1960 (Act 29) (Criminal Offences Act),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) National Media Commission Act, 1993 (Act 449) (National Media Commission Act),
texts.text: (c) National Media Commission Act, 1993 (Act 449) (National Media Commission Act),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) Data Protection Act, 2012 (Act 843),
texts.text: (d) Data Protection Act, 2012 (Act 843),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) the  National  Communications  Authority  Act,  2008  (Act  769)  (National Communications Division Act),
texts.text: (e) the  National  Communications  Authority  Act,  2008  (Act  769)  (National Communications Division Act),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) the Electronic Communications Act, 2008 (Act 775) (Electronic Communications) Act),
texts.text: (f) the Electronic Communications Act, 2008 (Act 775) (Electronic Communications) Act),

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) the State Secrets Act, 1962 (Act 101) (State Secrets Act)
texts.text: (g) the State Secrets Act, 1962 (Act 101) (State Secrets Act)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) the Political Parties Act, 2000 (Act 574) (Political Parties Act)
texts.text: (h) the Political Parties Act, 2000 (Act 574) (Political Parties Act)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) the  Security  and  Intelligence  Agencies  Act,  2020  (Act  1030)  (Securities  and Intelligence Agencies Act)
texts.text: (i) the  Security  and  Intelligence  Agencies  Act,  2020  (Act  1030)  (Securities  and Intelligence Agencies Act)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (j) Presidential Office Act, 1993 (Act 463) (Presidential Office Act)
texts.text: (j) Presidential Office Act, 1993 (Act 463) (Presidential Office Act)

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025
texts.text: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) Without limiting the effect of subsection (1), the Act shall not be interpreted to usurp or limit the mandate of the National Media Commission.
texts.text: Without limiting the effect of subsection (1), the Act shall not be interpreted to usurp or limit the mandate of the National Media Commission.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Principles on the Right to Freedom of Speech and Expression and the Right to Privacy
texts.text: Principles on the Right to Freedom of Speech and Expression and the Right to Privacy

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Enforcement and interpretation of constitutional rights
texts.text: Enforcement and interpretation of constitutional rights

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. The Act shall be enforced and interpreted in accordance with the right to freedom of speech and expression and the right to privacy under articles 21(1)(a) and 18(2) of the Constitution, respectively and Chapter 12 of the Constitution.
texts.text: The Act shall be enforced and interpreted in accordance with the right to freedom of speech and expression and the right to privacy under articles 21(1)(a) and 18(2) of the Constitution, respectively and Chapter 12 of the Constitution.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Balancing private benefit against public benefit
texts.text: Balancing private benefit against public benefit

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. In the application of the Act, the Court or Division (as the case may be) shall weigh the private benefit of enforcing the right to freedom of speech and expression and/or the right to privacy against the public benefit of protecting an individual, group of persons, private or public institution from the harm caused by the false information, hate speech or publication of other information.
texts.text: In the application of the Act, the Court or Division (as the case may be) shall weigh the private benefit of enforcing the right to freedom of speech and expression and/or the right to privacy against the public benefit of protecting an individual, group of persons, private or public institution from the harm caused by the false information, hate speech or publication of other information.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Application and interpretation in favour of constitutional rights
texts.text: Application and interpretation in favour of constitutional rights

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. (1) The Court or Division shall apply and/or interpret the Act in favour of the right to freedom  of  speech  and  expression  and  right  to  privacy  where  the  information  under consideration achieves a legitimate public benefit.
texts.text: (1) The Court or Division shall apply and/or interpret the Act in favour of the right to freedom  of  speech  and  expression  and  right  to  privacy  where  the  information  under consideration achieves a legitimate public benefit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) For the purpose of subsection (1), information is of legitimate public benefit if that information:
texts.text: For the purpose of subsection (1), information is of legitimate public benefit if that information:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) is intended to expose or exposes a person or institution's activities directly or indirectly  related  to,  or  connected  with  the  commission,  or  the  reasonable suspicion of commission of a crime under the laws of the Republic;
texts.text: (a) is intended to expose or exposes a person or institution's activities directly or indirectly  related  to,  or  connected  with  the  commission,  or  the  reasonable suspicion of commission of a crime under the laws of the Republic;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) is intended to expose or exposes a Government or public-related matter that is nationally dishonourable and inimical to values of probity and accountability;
texts.text: (b) is intended to expose or exposes a Government or public-related matter that is nationally dishonourable and inimical to values of probity and accountability;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) is  intended  to  criticise  or  criticises  the  Government  or  public  institution  in relation to the management of a public office or the performance of official duties of a government official or public officer;
texts.text: (c) is  intended  to  criticise  or  criticises  the  Government  or  public  institution  in relation to the management of a public office or the performance of official duties of a government official or public officer;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) is  intended  to  expose  or  exposes  civil  wrong  doing  done  by  or  against  an individual, group of persons, private and public institutions or the Government; or
texts.text: (d) is  intended  to  expose  or  exposes  civil  wrong  doing  done  by  or  against  an individual, group of persons, private and public institutions or the Government; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) relates to a controversial public health opinion that is capable of being proven.
texts.text: (e) relates to a controversial public health opinion that is capable of being proven.

texts.text: Establishment of liability

texts.orig: False information
texts.text: False information

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 19. (1) A statement or material is false if it is wrong, fake, misleading, deceptive, doctored, whether wholly or in part, and whether on its own or in the context in which it appears.
texts.text: 19. (1) A statement or material is false if it is wrong, fake, misleading, deceptive, doctored, whether wholly or in part, and whether on its own or in the context in which it appears.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)  Information  is  false  only  if  it  can  be  disproven  by  verified  and  factual  contrary information.
texts.text: (2)  Information  is  false  only  if  it  can  be  disproven  by  verified  and  factual  contrary information.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) A statement or material is false even if it is a partial disclosure of truth provided that the omission makes entire statement or material more misleading than true.
texts.text: (3) A statement or material is false even if it is a partial disclosure of truth provided that the omission makes entire statement or material more misleading than true.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4) Unless otherwise provided in this Act, the burden that the information is false lies on the person alleging that the information is false which may include the Division where appropriate.

texts.label: text

texts.text: 20. (1)  Except  for  hate  speech  under  this  Act,  a  person  shall  be  made  liable  for communication of information if that person has control over the information.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) A person has control over the information if that person:

texts.text: (a) is the original disseminator of the information;

texts.text: (c) used, instructed  or  guided  another  person  or  instrument  to  make  the publication; or

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (e) is able publish or remove content relating to the information without recourse to  the original author; or

texts.orig: (3) Nothing in this Act shall prevent an employee from being jointly or severally liable with an employer who retains authorship of the information published in the course of employment.

texts.label: text

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 36. The communication or dissemination of hate speech in the Republic is prohibited.
texts.text: The communication or dissemination of hate speech in the Republic is prohibited.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition of Hate Speech
texts.text: Definition of Hate Speech

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 37. (1) Hate speech means any communication in speech, writing, behaviour or expression that uses pejorative or discriminatory language which:
texts.text: (1) Hate speech means any communication in speech, writing, behaviour or expression that uses pejorative or discriminatory language which:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) vilifies, threatens, harasses, degrades, stigmatises, humiliates, discriminates or
texts.text: (a) vilifies, threatens, harasses, degrades, stigmatises, humiliates, discriminates or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) promotes negative feelings, hostility, attitudes or perceptions or
texts.text: (b) promotes negative feelings, hostility, attitudes or perceptions or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) incites hatred or violence
texts.text: (c) incites hatred or violence

texts.label: text
texts.orig: towards a group or class of people based on their race, ethnicity, colour, descent, religion, sex, background, other identity factor.
texts.text: towards a group or class of people based on their race, ethnicity, colour, descent, religion, sex, background, other identity factor.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Hate speech may be based on facts, prejudice, bias, generalisations or stereotypes.
texts.text: Hate speech may be based on facts, prejudice, bias, generalisations or stereotypes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) A factual statement which incites threats, hatred, violence towards a group or class of people based on their way of life constitutes hate speech.
texts.text: A factual statement which incites threats, hatred, violence towards a group or class of people based on their way of life constitutes hate speech.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) Provided the hate speech affects an individual or group's dignity, security, wellbeing, reputation and status in society, it is immaterial that the offending party did not intend the consequences of his or her actions.
texts.text: Provided the hate speech affects an individual or group's dignity, security, wellbeing, reputation and status in society, it is immaterial that the offending party did not intend the consequences of his or her actions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) Communication circulated as means of entertainment in a movie, song, parody, skit or as a satire that meets the threshold of hate speech in subsection (1) or (3) constitutes hate speech under this Act.
texts.text: Communication circulated as means of entertainment in a movie, song, parody, skit or as a satire that meets the threshold of hate speech in subsection (1) or (3) constitutes hate speech under this Act.

texts.text: (1) A person shall be made liable for communication of hate speech if that person had control over the communication.

texts.orig: (c) is not the original disseminator of the communication but retains authorship of the original communication; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) used, instructed or guided another person or instrument to  make  the communication; or
texts.text: (d) used, instructed or guided another person or instrument to  make  the communication; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) is able to substantially dictate how that content of that communication should be framed, edited or published; or
texts.text: (e) is able to substantially dictate how that content of that communication should be framed, edited or published; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) is able communicate or remove content relating to the communication without recourse to the original author; or
texts.text: (f) is able communicate or remove content relating to the communication without recourse to the original author; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) threatens, blackmails or compels another person to release the communication.

texts.orig: 'public  institution'  means  a  covered  entity,  a  state-owned  enterprise,  a  public corporation or a public service entity and excludes the Government, Office of the President and Ministries;
texts.text: 'public  institution'  means  a  covered  entity,  a  state-owned  enterprise,  a  public corporation or a public service entity and excludes the Government, Office of the President and Ministries;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public morals' means anything relating to shared social and ethical standards in the Republic for the time being;
texts.text: 'public morals' means anything relating to shared social and ethical standards in the Republic for the time being;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public  office'  includes  an  office  whose  emoluments  are  paid  directly  from  the Consolidated Fund or directly out of moneys provided by Parliament and an office in a public corporation established entirely out of public funds or moneys provided by Parliament;
texts.text: 'public  office'  includes  an  office  whose  emoluments  are  paid  directly  from  the Consolidated Fund or directly out of moneys provided by Parliament and an office in a public corporation established entirely out of public funds or moneys provided by Parliament;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public officer' includes the holder of a public office and a person appointed to act in that office;
texts.text: 'public officer' includes the holder of a public office and a person appointed to act in that office;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public or social media commentator' means an individual who for whatever intended purposes, is known by a group of people for regularly sharing opinions, analysis or reactions,  commentary  on  mass  media  trends,  events  and  issues,  articles,  news, politics,  sociology,  law,  business,  economics,  public  health,  medicine  or  any specialised field of study;
texts.text: 'public or social media commentator' means an individual who for whatever intended purposes, is known by a group of people for regularly sharing opinions, analysis or reactions,  commentary  on  mass  media  trends,  events  and  issues,  articles,  news, politics,  sociology,  law,  business,  economics,  public  health,  medicine  or  any specialised field of study;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public order' means anything relating to public peace, public safety and the functioning of a place in the Republic conducive for living and for the enjoyment of rights under the Constitution;
texts.text: 'public order' means anything relating to public peace, public safety and the functioning of a place in the Republic conducive for living and for the enjoyment of rights under the Constitution;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public rights' means rights or claims under the Act that benefits the common interest of the public even it personally affects the aggrieved person or issuing party and is which right or claim is also determined by the type of sanction or remedy that is sought.
texts.text: 'public rights' means rights or claims under the Act that benefits the common interest of the public even it personally affects the aggrieved person or issuing party and is which right or claim is also determined by the type of sanction or remedy that is sought.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public safety' means the anything relating to the protection of people in the Republic from  events  that  cause  violence,  threat  of  harm,  harm  or  injury  or  damage  to property;
texts.text: 'public safety' means the anything relating to the protection of people in the Republic from  events  that  cause  violence,  threat  of  harm,  harm  or  injury  or  damage  to property;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public service entity' means an entity funded by tax revenue of the  Republic which provides public services;
texts.text: 'public service entity' means an entity funded by tax revenue of the  Republic which provides public services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public services' means a community-based service that is typically provided by the Government but which may be provided by private persons and includes services such  as  education,  medical,  healthcare,  public  health,  sanitation,  research,  public safety, transportation, social services, housing and urban development, utilities and environmental protection;
texts.text: 'public services' means a community-based service that is typically provided by the Government but which may be provided by private persons and includes services such  as  education,  medical,  healthcare,  public  health,  sanitation,  research,  public safety, transportation, social services, housing and urban development, utilities and environmental protection;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public trust' means confidence that the people in the Republic have in a person to act honestly, fairly and transparently;
texts.text: 'public trust' means confidence that the people in the Republic have in a person to act honestly, fairly and transparently;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'public welfare' means the general well-being of the people in the Republic, including social, economic and psychological wellbeing.
texts.text: 'public welfare' means the general well-being of the people in the Republic, including social, economic and psychological wellbeing.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'publication' means distributing a statement, material or content to the public;
texts.text: 'publication' means distributing a statement, material or content to the public;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'referendum' means referendum under the Constitution;
texts.text: 'referendum' means referendum under the Constitution;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'Regulations' means legislative instrument in respect of the Act;
texts.text: 'Regulations' means legislative instrument in respect of the Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'relevant authorities' means authorities in charge of regulating that industry of sector;
texts.text: 'relevant authorities' means authorities in charge of regulating that industry of sector;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'remedy' means a decision that that is intended to cure, correct or prevent unlawful conduct;
texts.text: 'remedy' means a decision that that is intended to cure, correct or prevent unlawful conduct;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'Report' means an informal allegation of wrong doing under the Act intended to draw the Division's attention to the act or mission;
texts.text: 'Report' means an informal allegation of wrong doing under the Act intended to draw the Division's attention to the act or mission;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'Republic' means the sovereign State of Ghana including its territories;
texts.text: 'Republic' means the sovereign State of Ghana including its territories;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025
texts.text: MISINFORMATION, DISINFORMATION, HATE SPEECH AND PUBLICATION OF OTHER INFORMATION (MDHI) BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'republish' means to publish again, reprint, reissue, reposting, co-publish, or repeat and for the avoidance of doubt includes 'retweeting' on X;
texts.text: 'republish' means to publish again, reprint, reissue, reposting, co-publish, or repeat and for the avoidance of doubt includes 'retweeting' on X;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'resident' means a person issued a resident permit by the Ghana Immigration Service or:
texts.text: 'resident' means a person issued a resident permit by the Ghana Immigration Service or:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) that person has been present in this country for an aggregate period of not less than 183 days in any 12-month period, regardless of temporary absences; and
texts.text: (a) that person has been present in this country for an aggregate period of not less than 183 days in any 12-month period, regardless of temporary absences; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) has  adopted  living  in  the  country  for  settled  purposes  as  part  of    regular activities.
texts.text: (b) has  adopted  living  in  the  country  for  settled  purposes  as  part  of    regular activities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'respondent' means an offending party person representing the offending party who responds to a Complaint.
texts.text: 'respondent' means an offending party person representing the offending party who responds to a Complaint.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'sanction'  means  a  decision  that  is  intended  to  discourage  unlawful  behaviour  and includes civil and criminal penalties;
texts.text: 'sanction'  means  a  decision  that  is  intended  to  discourage  unlawful  behaviour  and includes civil and criminal penalties;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'SMS' means a system that enables the transmission, through a mobile network, of text messages;
texts.text: 'SMS' means a system that enables the transmission, through a mobile network, of text messages;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'social media networking service' means service related to social media;
texts.text: 'social media networking service' means service related to social media;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'social media' means communication platforms through the internet that allow people to create and share information through text, video, photos and other content and includes  dating  sites  and  platforms  such  as  Facebook,  X,  WhatsApp,  Snapchat, Tiktok, Instagram and other similar platforms;
texts.text: 'social media' means communication platforms through the internet that allow people to create and share information through text, video, photos and other content and includes  dating  sites  and  platforms  such  as  Facebook,  X,  WhatsApp,  Snapchat, Tiktok, Instagram and other similar platforms;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'state-owned  enterprise'  means  an  entity  whether  incorporated  or  not  under  the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992) whose shares are wholly or substantially held or controlled by the Government;
texts.text: 'state-owned  enterprise'  means  an  entity  whether  incorporated  or  not  under  the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992) whose shares are wholly or substantially held or controlled by the Government;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'State' means the Republic;
texts.text: 'State' means the Republic;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'State Party' means any country that has ratified, accepted or acceded to a treaty;
texts.text: 'State Party' means any country that has ratified, accepted or acceded to a treaty;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'statement'  means  any  word  (including  abbreviation  and  initial),  number,  image (moving or otherwise), sound, symbol or other representation, Artificial Intelligence generated information, or a combination of any of these;
texts.text: 'statement'  means  any  word  (including  abbreviation  and  initial),  number,  image (moving or otherwise), sound, symbol or other representation, Artificial Intelligence generated information, or a combination of any of these;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'statutory board' a Board established under statute;
texts.text: 'statutory board' a Board established under statute;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'statutory law' means an Act of Parliament or any other subsidiary legislation;
texts.text: 'statutory law' means an Act of Parliament or any other subsidiary legislation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'Superior Court of Judicature' means the High Court of the  Republic, the Court of Appeal of the Republic and the Supreme Court of the Republic;
texts.text: 'Superior Court of Judicature' means the High Court of the  Republic, the Court of Appeal of the Republic and the Supreme Court of the Republic;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'territory'  means  area,  including  land,  air  space  or  water  under  the  control  or jurisdiction of a State;
texts.text: 'territory'  means  area,  including  land,  air  space  or  water  under  the  control  or jurisdiction of a State;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'threat of harm' means a statement of an intention to inflict pain, injury, damage or other hostile action or to cause fear of harm;
texts.text: 'threat of harm' means a statement of an intention to inflict pain, injury, damage or other hostile action or to cause fear of harm;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'Unit'  means  a  sub-division  of  the  Division  for  administrative  and  enforcement purposes;
texts.text: 'Unit'  means  a  sub-division  of  the  Division  for  administrative  and  enforcement purposes;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Vice-President' means Vice-President of the Republic;
texts.text: 'Vice-President' means Vice-President of the Republic;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'violence'  means  an  intentional  or  unintentional  use  of  physical  force  or  power, threatened  or  actual,  against  another  person  that  either  results  in  or  has  a  real likelihood in injury, death or psychological harm; and
texts.text: 'violence'  means  an  intentional  or  unintentional  use  of  physical  force  or  power, threatened  or  actual,  against  another  person  that  either  results  in  or  has  a  real likelihood in injury, death or psychological harm; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'worker'  means  a  person  who  is  engaged  as  an  independent  contract  or  provides services to a person who is not his or her employer and includes a freelancer.
texts.text: 'worker'  means  a  person  who  is  engaged  as  an  independent  contract  or  provides services to a person who is not his or her employer and includes a freelancer.
